newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila said Fu visit should help resolve disputes.
newsitem.headline: Manila said Fu visit should help resolve disputes.

text.p: Philippine President Fidel Ramos said on Wednesday that current six-day visit by Chinese General Fu Quanyou should help solve disputes between Manila and Beijing.
Fu is chief of the general staff of the People's Liberation Army (PLA).
"We see this as a very good beginning for the continued cooperation, exchange of information and eventual resolution of any problems among us," Ramos told a news conference.
China and the Philippines are among six countries which have staked claims to parts or the whole of the potentially oil-rich Spratly Islands in the South China Sea.
The other claimants are Malaysia, Vietnam, Taiwan and Brunei.

Relations between Manila and Beijing soured last year when Ramos accused the Chinese of building what looked like naval support installations on Mischief Reef in a portion of the Spratlys which the Philippines claims.
China, which claims all of the Spratly Islands, has said the structures were shelters for fishermen and has refused to leave the area.
Fu, who arrived on Sunday, is to tour the Subic Bay free port on Friday, formerly the site of a U.S. naval base.
On Wednesday, he watched a Philippine Army special forces demonstration of counter-terrorist and rescue operations.
